com.mindfusion.scheduling

Class Calendar

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • javax.swing.JComponent
          • com.mindfusion.scheduling.Calendar
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.datatransfer.ClipboardOwner, java.awt.event.ComponentListener, java.awt.event.KeyListener, java.awt.event.MouseListener, java.awt.event.MouseMotionListener, java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.awt.print.Printable, java.io.Serializable, java.util.EventListener, javax.swing.event.AncestorListener, javax.swing.Scrollable

    public class Calendar
extends javax.swing.JComponent
implements java.awt.print.Printable, javax.swing.Scrollable, javax.swing.event.AncestorListener, java.awt.datatransfer.ClipboardOwner, java.awt.event.MouseListener, java.awt.event.MouseMotionListener, java.awt.event.KeyListener, java.awt.event.ComponentListener
    The Calendar control serves as a view in document-view architecture, where the document is implemented by the Schedule class. The Calendar provides several views modes, such as SingleMonth, List, Timetable, that present the scheduled events in different style, layout and resolution.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • dispose

        public void dispose()
        Description copied from class: Calendar
        Disposes any resources used by this Calendar object.

        It is important to call Calendar.dispose() on the object when you are done using it, in order to terminate the associated timers.

      • printPreview

        public void printPreview()
        Description copied from class: Calendar
        Displays a print preview window, that shows how the diagram would look when printed on paper. The preview is rendered with the same settings that are used for printing, assigned via Calendar.getPrintOptions(). That ensures uniform output of the printed document both on paper and in the preview window. Print job settings include document title and several flags that control whether images, shadows, headers, etc. are printed.

      • printPreview

        public void printPreview(java.awt.print.PageFormat pageFormat)
        Description copied from class: Calendar
        Displays a print preview window, that shows how the diagram would look when printed on paper. The preview is rendered with the same settings that are used for printing, assigned via Calendar.getPrintOptions(). That ensures uniform output of the printed document both on paper and in the preview window. Print job settings include document title and several flags that control whether images, shadows, headers, etc. are printed.

      • ensureVisible

        public void ensureVisible(DateTime date,
                          Resource resource)
        Description copied from class: Calendar
        Ensures that the specified date is visible within the control, scrolling the contents of the control if necessary. The resource parameter allows specifying a Task, Location, Contact or Resource for which to display the date in a view with enabled grouping.

        This method does nothing if the specified date is not included in the time-period displayed in the current view.

        Parameters:
        date - A DateTime instance identifying the date to scroll into view.
        resource - A reference to Task, Location, Contact or Resource whose group to display in the view.

      • setViewport

        public void setViewport(DateTime start,
                        DateTime end,
                        boolean adjustResolution)
        Description copied from class: Calendar
        Sets the displayed time interval to the specified range, optionally changing the view resolution. If the interval is outside of the view range, the view range is expanded to include the interval.

        This method operates only in Resource view. In addition, the resource view must not have hidden days or hours.

        Parameters:
        start - The start of the interval to display.
        end - The end of the interval to display.
        adjustResolution - true to change the view resolution if necessary; false to keep the current resolution and adjust only the scale.

      • resetDrag

        public void resetDrag()
        Description copied from class: Calendar
        If there is a mouse drag operation in progress, it is canceled.

        Call this method if a message box or a modal dialog must be displayed in response to various Click events, to prevent the component from continuing tracking the mouse.

      • suspendDrag

        public void suspendDrag()
        Description copied from class: Calendar
        Temporarily pauses the current mouse drag operation.

        Use this method in conjunction with the Calendar.resumeDrag() method to temporarily disable control response to user interactions. The most common scenario where you would use these two methods is when you want to display a modal dialog during user interaction without terminating it.

      • resumeDrag

        public void resumeDrag()
        Description copied from class: Calendar
        Resumes the previously paused mouse drag operation.

        Use this method in conjunction with the Calendar.suspendDrag() method to temporarily disable control response to user interactions. The most common scenario where you would use these two methods is when you want to display a modal dialog during user interaction without terminating it.

        Sets a value indicating whether users are allowed to edit items interactively.

        If this method is invoked with false, users cannot edit items' text interactively. Controlling the editing of item text can be done by handling the CalendarListener.itemInplaceEditStarting(com.mindfusion.scheduling.ItemConfirmEvent) and CalendarListener.itemInplaceEditEnding(com.mindfusion.scheduling.ItemEditConfirmEvent) events.

        Parameters:

      • getAllowInplaceCreate

        public boolean getAllowInplaceCreate()
        Description copied from class: Calendar
        Gets a value indicating whether users are allowed to create items interactively.
        Returns:
        true to allow users to create schedule items; otherwise, false. The default is true.

      • setAllowInplaceCreate

        public void setAllowInplaceCreate(boolean value)
        Description copied from class: Calendar
        Sets a value indicating whether users are allowed to create items interactively.

        If this property is disabled, users cannot create items interactively. If it is enabled and Calendar.getInteractiveItemType() is not null, a new schedule item of the specified type is created when users start typing in a time cell. This raises the CalendarListener.itemCreating(com.mindfusion.scheduling.ItemConfirmEvent) event, which lets the client application validate the operation or cancel it.

        Parameters:
        value - true to allow users to create schedule items; otherwise, false.

      • getAllowAutoScroll

        public boolean getAllowAutoScroll()
        Description copied from class: Calendar
        Gets a value indicating whether the control scrolls automatically its contents when users drag items near the edge of the client rectangle.
        Returns:
        true to enable automatic scrolling; otherwise, false. The default is true.

      • setAllowAutoScroll

        public void setAllowAutoScroll(boolean value)
        Description copied from class: Calendar
        Sets a value indicating whether the control scrolls automatically its contents when users drag items near the edge of the client rectangle.

        Automatic scrolling starts when a schedule item or a selection of items is dragged near the borders of the calendar contents rectangle. The contents rectangle is the part of a calendar view that contains all time cells and excludes the headers. If the mouse is moved outside the contents rectangle, the scrolling stops.

        Parameters:
        value - true to enable automatic scrolling; otherwise, false.

      • getItemChangeResourceKey

        public int getItemChangeResourceKey()
        Description copied from class: Calendar
        Gets the modifier key, which lets users drag items between different contacts, resources, locations or tasks in a grouped view.

        By default an item dragged in a grouped view can be dropped only into a column associated with the original contact, location or task of the item. This behavior can be overridden by pressing a modifier key while dragging. That allows dropping the item into a column of a different contact, location or task, thus changing the original contact, location or task.

        One of the KeyEvent constants. The default is 0.

        Description copied from class: Calendar
        Sets a value indicating whether items are created merely by dragging in the control.

        By default, the items are created interactively by selecting a time range in the current view and typing. Invoking this method and passing true as an argument overrides this behavior and enables users to create items by clicking and dragging.

        Parameters:
        value - true to enable interactive item creation when the users clicks and drags in the control; false to disable it. The default is false.

      • getStartEditAfterModify

        public boolean getStartEditAfterModify()
        Description copied from class: Calendar
        Gets a value indicating whether in-place editing of items should automatically start after they are modified interactively.
        Returns:
        true to enable automatic in-place editing after item modification; false to disable it. The default is false.

      • setStartEditAfterModify

        public void setStartEditAfterModify(boolean value)
        Description copied from class: Calendar

        value - true to enable automatic in-place editing after item modification; false to disable it.

      • setHScrollerVisible

        public void setHScrollerVisible(java.lang.Boolean value)
        Description copied from class: Calendar
        Sets a value indicating whether the horizontal scrollbar should always be visible, always hidden or visible only when it is needed.

        Specify false for this method to always hide the scrollbar, true, to always show it and null to let the Calendar component decide when to show the scrollbar.

        Parameters:
        value - A Boolean value specifying the visibility state of the horizontal scrollbar.
